column4: hi guys, i'm trying to just sudo apt-get install openssh-server but i'm getting an error, how to fix? http://pastebin.com/NTTg105x
sudo apt-get update; sudo apt-get install -f ;
ok, so would it be sudo apt-get install -f openssh-server?
I think that might also work but not needed
you have some ppa repository for ssh?
what if we sudo apt-get install openssh-client ;
says openssh-client is already the newest version; 0 upgraded, 0 newly installed, 0 to remove and 2 not upgraded.
but when i do sudo apt-get remove openssh-client it doesn't remove it..
i do sudo-apt get remove openssh-client ->  just says 0 upgraded, 0 newly installed, 0 to remove and 2 not upgraded
I'm afread to verify as I need ssh client
what version of ubuntu is this?
I'll have to look if I have an iso 10.10 that I can run in virtualbox to verify
oh ubuntu 10.10 is at endo of life on April 2012
so I guess you may be forced to upgrade or down grade to 10.04 lts
